Description: Nine beads in different shapes and materials. A: Ovoid-shaped bead made of amethyst, well polished, cylindrical perforation across the longitudinal side. B: Elongated barrel-shaped bead made of dark blue glass, very shiny at the outer surface, slightly broken at one end. C: Flattened spherical bead made of dark green glass. D: One ring-shaped bead made of turquoise faience. E: Five segmented cylindrical beads made of light blue faience, one of them preserved to over 2cm.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
